member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Cryptography.Configuration.Manageability.SymmetricStorageEncryptionProviderDataManageabilityProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class.
Adds the ADM instructions that describe the policies that can be used to override the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks:
The default implementation for this method creates a policy, using to create the policy name and invoking
to add the policy parts. Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy must override this method to just add the parts.

member.summary: Adds the ADM parts that represent the properties of a specific instance of the configuration element type managed by the receiver.
member.param: The to which the Adm instructions are to be appended.
The configuration source from where to get additional configuration information, if necessary.
The key for the element's policies.
member.remarks: Subclasses managing objects that must not create a policy will likely need to include the elements' keys when creating the parts.

member.summary: Overrides the 's properties with the Group Policy values from the registry.
member.param: The configuration object for instances that must be managed.
The which holds the Group Policy overrides for the configuration element.
member.remarks: Subclasses implementing this method must retrieve all the override values from the registry before making modifications to the so any error retrieving the override values will cancel policy processing.

member.summary: Gets the template for the name of the policy associated to the object.
member.remarks:
Elements that override
to avoid creating a policy must still override this property.
